contentrichtext.text: {{Use dmy dates|date=August 2012}} {{Use British English|date=August 2012}} {{Infobox London station|symbol=underground| name = Kilburn Park | image_name =Kilburn park tube station.jpg | manager = [[London Underground]] | fare_zone = 2 | locale = [[Kilburn, London|Kilburn]] | borough = [[London Borough of Brent]] | years1=1915 |events1=Opened | platforms= 2 <!--| tubeexits06 = 3.267 | tubeexits07 = {{increase}} 3.363--> | tubeexits08 = {{increase}} 3.620 | tubeexits09 = {{increase}} 4.068 | tubeexits10 = {{decrease}} 3.790 | latitude=51.535124 | longitude=-0.194063 | map_type=Central London | label_position=right}} '''Kilburn Park tube station''' is a Grade II listed [[London Underground]] station at [[Kilburn, London|Kilburn]] in the [[London Borough of Brent]]. The station is on the [[Bakerloo line|Bakerloo Line]], between [[Queen's Park station|Queen's Park]] and [[Maida Vale tube station|Maida Vale]] stations, and is in [[Travelcard]] [[Travelcard Zone 2|Zone 2]]. The station is situated on Cambridge Avenue approximately 100 m west of [[Kilburn High Road]], shortly before it becomes [[Maida Vale]], ([[A5 road (Great Britain)|A5]]). ==History== Kilburn Park was opened on 31 January 1915 as the temporary terminus of the Bakerloo line's extension from [[London Paddington station|Paddington station]] towards Queen's Park.<ref name=rose>{{cite book |last=Rose |first=Douglas |title=The London Underground, A Diagrammatic History |year=1999 |publisher=Douglas Rose/Capital Transport |isbn=1-85414-219-4 }}</ref> Services were extended to Queen's Park on 11 February 1915.<ref name=rose/> At the extension's opening, Maida Vale station was not complete and the previous station was [[Warwick Avenue tube station|Warwick Avenue]] until 6 June 1915.<ref name=rose/> The station building was designed by [[Stanley Heaps]] in a modified version of the earlier [[Leslie Green]] designed Bakerloo line stations with [[Glazed architectural terra-cotta|glazed terra cotta]] façades but without the large semi-circular windows at first floor level. It was one of the first London Underground stations built specifically to use [[escalator]]s rather than [[elevator|lifts]].<ref name=escalators>The first escalator on the Underground was installed at [[Earl's Court tube station|Earl's Court]] in 1911. The first station built specifically for escalators was the new Central line station at [[Liverpool Street station|Liverpool Street]] in 1912. All deep-tube stations built after 1913 were built with escalators - {{cite book |last=Wolmar |first=Christian |authorlink = Christian Wolmar |title = The Subterranean Railway: How the London Underground Was Built and How It Changed the City Forever |publisher = Atlantic Books |year=2004 |chapter=Beginning to Make Sense |pages=205–206 |isbn=1-84354-023-1}}</ref> ==Transport links== [[List of bus routes in London|Bus routes]] [[London Buses route 31|31]], [[London Buses route 32|32]], [[London Buses route 206|206]], [[London Buses route 316|316]], [[London Buses route 328|328]], school route [[London Buses route 632|632]] and night routes [[London Buses route N28|N28]] and [[London Buses route N31|N31]] serve the station. Also, it is only a short walk from [[Kilburn High Road railway station|Kilburn High Road Station (London Overground)]]. ==Gallery== <gallery> File:Kilburn park tube ticket hall.jpg|Ticket hall File:Kilburn Park tube ticket window.jpg|Ticket window File:KilburnPark2.jpg|Glazed, domed roof over the escalators File:Kilburn Park tube southbound platform.jpg|The southbound platform </gallery> ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *[http://photos.ltmcollection.org London's Transport Museum Photographic Archive] **{{ltmcollection|34/9884934.jpg|Kilburn Park station, 1925}} **{{ltmcollection|r7/i0000jr7.jpg|Lower concourse looking towards escalators, 2006}} {{s-start}} {{s-rail|title=LUL}} {{s-line|system=LUL|line=Bakerloo|previous=Queen's Park|next=Maida Vale}} {{s-end}} {{Bakerloo line navbox}} [[Category:Bakerloo Line stations]] [[Category:Tube stations in Brent]] [[Category:Former London Electric Railway stations]] [[Category:Railway stations opened in 1915]]
